markdownRemark.html:
If you’re using Firefox and have the Tree Style Tab (TST) extension installed, you can open an empty TST group by typing the following into the URL bar:

about:treestyletab-group?title=MyGroup.

Empty TST groups are useful for when you need a space to throw bunch of browser tabs at.

If you’re on Linux or Mac you can speed up the process of create a new TST group tab by placing the following script in your $PATH:

#!/usr/bin/fish
#
# Usage: tabgroup ARG1 ARG2...ARGN
#
# Purpose: Open up one or more temporary treestyletab
# groups in Firefox with the specified names.

function tabgroup
  if not count $argv > /dev/null
    return
  end
  for title in $argv
    firefox "about:treestyletab-group?title=$title"
  end
end

Note: Make sure you have fish shell installed.

Once you have this ready to go, you can then pop open a terminal and open either:

  • A single TST group

    • tabgroup mytabgroup

  • Multiple TST groups

    • tabgroup groupone grouptwo groupthree
